info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:22PM CDT until May 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR EASTERN COCHRAN AND HOCKLEY COUNTIES... At 521 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Whitharral to 3 miles northeast of Levelland to 6 miles southeast of Sundown, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 515 PM CDT, the West Texas Mesonet near Sundown measured a wind gust of 65 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Levelland, Sundown, Anton, Whitharral, Pep, Smyer, Whiteface, and Opdyke West. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
